item.title: 'New York Times' lawsuit creates a new headache for Pentagon chief Hegseth
item.description: The Times accuses Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth of violating its constitutional rights with a press policy that, the paper says, deprives the public of access to critical national security information.

item.title: In an era of rising prices, computers have gotten cheaper. (And why that may end)
item.description: One thing has bucked the trend of rising prices: computing. Technological advances have underpinned a consistent drop in the cost of computers. But experts say that this may be reaching a limit.

item.title: Trump administration rolls back fuel economy standards
item.description: At the White House this afternoon, President Trump said he was terminating "ridiculously burdensome" fuel economy rules. It's part of a series of changes relaxing or eliminating rules promoting cleaner cars.

item.title: Italian pasta could 'disappear' from American supermarket shelves
item.description: Americans' most loved Italian food staple could soon double in price or disappear from supermarket shelves following tariffs imposed by the Trump administration that could go into force from January.

item.description: Costco has filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's tariffs. The retailer joins other companies hoping to get a refund for the import taxes it's already paid.
